intro: Blepharis acaulis, commonly known as the hairless blepharis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its upright, branching stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually pale blue or violet, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds. Blepharis acaulis is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops.
